param-doc.name: skipWhitespace
param-doc.p: Either the match allows arbitrary insertion of whitespace characters in the subject. For instance, the contents amino acid matches the entry aminoacid.

param-doc.name: strictColumnNumber
param-doc.p: Either to check that every line in has the same number of columns as the number of features specified in .

param-doc.name: skipBlank
param-doc.p: In , skip lines that contain only whitespace characters.

param-doc.name: constantAnnotationFeatures
param-doc.p: Constant features to add to each annotation created by this module

param-doc.name: subject
param-doc.p: Specifies the contents to match.

param-doc.name: trieSink
param-doc.p: If set, writes the compiled dictionary to the specified file.

param-doc.name: wordStartCaseInsensitive
param-doc.p: Either the match allows case substitution on the first character of words.

param-doc.name: caseInsensitive
param-doc.p: Either the match allows case substitutions on all characters.

param-doc.name: allowJoined
param-doc.p: Either the match allows arbitrary suppression of whitespace characters in the subject. For instance, the contents aminoacid matches the entry amino acid.

param-doc.name: trimColumns
param-doc.p: Either to trim column values in from leading and trailing whitespace characters.

param-doc.name: targetLayerName
param-doc.p: Name of the layer that contains the match annotations.

param-doc.name: dictFile
param-doc.p: Source of the dictionary.

param-doc.name: active
param-doc.p: This expression is evaluated as a boolean with the corpus as the context element, the module will process the document only if the result is true.

param-doc.name: skipEmpty
param-doc.p: In , skip empty lines.

param-doc.name: trieSource
param-doc.p: If set, read the compiled dictionary from the specified files. Compiled dictionaries are generally faster for large dictionaries.

param-doc.name: skipConsecutiveWhitespaces
param-doc.p: Either the match allows insertion of consecutive whitespace characters in the subject. For instance, the contents amino acid matches the entry amino acid.

param-doc.name: separator
param-doc.p: Specifies the character that separates columns in .

param-doc.name: documentFilter
param-doc.p: Only process document that satisfy this filter.

param-doc.name: valueFeatures
param-doc.p: Target features in match annotations. The values are the columns in the matched entry line.

param-doc.name: joinDash
param-doc.p: Either to treat dash characters (-) as whitespace characters if is true. For instance, the contents aminoacid matches the entry amino-acid.

param-doc.name: multipleEntryBehaviour
param-doc.p: Specifies the behavious of if contains several entries with the same key.

param-doc.name: allUpperCaseInsensitive
param-doc.p: Either the match allows case substitution on all characters in words that are all upper case.

param-doc.name: sectionFilter
param-doc.p: Process only sections that satisfy this filter.

param-doc.name: ignoreDiacritics
param-doc.p: Either the match allows dicacritics substitutions on all characters. For instance the contents acide amine matches the entry acide amin√©.

param-doc.name: matchStartCaseInsensitive
param-doc.p: Either the match allows case substitution on the first character of the entry key.

param-doc.name: keyIndex
param-doc.p: Specifies the key column index (starting at 0).

param-doc.name: userFunctions
param-doc.p: Set user functions available for this module. If this module is a sequence, then all compounds inherit its functions.
